replies.body: If there is one thing NA does not lack, it's stories. Every team has a reason to root for or against, depending on where your allegiance(s) lie.
Not gonna lie, I am probably more excited for this split than any other prior split. I feel like the competition and skill will be much higher compared to past splits.

i kinda feel the same way.. Hope the scene want be as one-sided as the two last splits... With Dignitas picking up Zion and Shiphtur, Curse picking up Xpecial, TSM hopefully solving their leadership problems, LMQ joining the league, CLG getting a new top lamer from the best region in the world, and C9 changing nothing what so ever; it seems promising for most teams. Hopefully most teams will show up better now; and give C9 a run for their money. Can't wait till may 23. :)
The USA ain't known as the "melting pot" of cultures for nothing.
It used to be a melting pot.  It is a "tossed salad" now.  People come from all over, but maintain their cultures and don't fully assimilate.
True, but i hate how other regions criticize NA for taking in the foreign players and not having "true" North American talent. Except for Cloud 9 of course.
TBH I am disappointed in our lack of looking into the challenger scene for talent. The over reliance on other regions just proves our own region is weak.
all the players on exsisting teams are ranked in challenger. The pro scene is made up of the challenger scene already, how much more can we look into it?
I watch NA LCS not for the game nor the big play, I watch it for the players and the rivalry.
Overall, compared to last split, this split showcases a balanced team roster. Every team looks really good right now.

People were saying the same thing at the beginning of last split as well though. I remember listening to people tell me how amazing the new Curse Lineup was going to be at the beginning of last season, or how EG was going to dominate the NA scene.
Last season curse started strong with 7 straight wins i believe its curse they always melt down. its there Curse.

If EVIL GENIUSES changes it's roster the two weakest members of the team are clearly YellowPete and Snoopeh. But will they have the guts to send both packing back to EU? Or will they more likely find fault in Innox and Pobelter, the two players that saved them from relegation?
Was thinking the same exact thing
No hate on pobeltor, but what EG need is the return of the Froggen.
What Froggen needs is to stay the hell away from that dying team

The positions that were in tryout were the bottom lane and jungle. Krepo deffinitelly deserves to be therebut about the other two i'm not sure..Anyway to answer, no they wont find fault in Innox and Pob and they are deffinitelly in the team

Yeah, ever since Season 2 Pete, Snoopeh, and Krepo have all been underwhelming. The correct thing to do in my view at this point really would be to find solid replacements for at least Snoopeh and Pete, as I could see an argument at the least for keeping Krepo on. Truth be told though, EG's backbone in Season 3 was Froggen. Without him, they seem lost. They have never had the highest level of mechanical skill overall, and it now seems clear that their old grasp of strategy isn't serving them well. They need to find an entirely new identity in order to be successful, and after a year and a half of trying to find one on their own, it seems likely that they will need a significantly different core lineup in order to find one.

My prediction would be:
1. CLG
2. C9
3. TSM
4. LMQ
5. Dignitas
6. Curse
7. EG
8. Complexity

I just hope that the games are close like in EU
Cloud 9 is not going to be 2nd, sorry.
Yeah probably 4th or 5th

I believe this split will be a lot more competitive than the last one. Seraph looks way better than Nien. The new TSM roster is promising and LMQ looks amazing. Dignitas filled its worse positions with the best players of Coast, and with Xpecial, Curse will finally have a real bot lane. CompLexity also looks strong. 

The only team without changes and that I don't see much future in it is EG.
First we have a chinese team in NA (LMQ), now we're seeing CLG with a korean top laner... Things are really heating up here xD
People shouldn't get too hyped up about CLGs new top laner, me thinks. No one has seen him play and he was only on a sub position. It is something that we should keep an eye on though.

Don't forget that Seraph was the sub for NaJiN White Shield, which is nowadays probably the best team in Korea (and by assumption the world). The experience and game knowledge he will bring cannot be underestimated either.

He was a sub of Save i think.. So yeah he was a sub, but being a sub to one of the best toplaners in the world isn't really bad. The only game he played was vs Samsung Ozone and kaned against Looper. He won his lane but his team lost the game. He was #17 in Korean Ladder (believe me that proves he is really really good). P.s. we have seen him playing and he is very good just overextends a bit which i dont believe he will do in LCS + Darius was heard in oddones stream saying Seraph is the only person that solokilled him a couple of times
Motecristo is conducted the korean hype train... CLG getting a korean player doesn't surprise me XD

LMQ have improved an amazing amount as a team throughout the spring Challenger Series. Before the spring split started, LMQ played 3 consecutive games against TSM in an unofficial series, which they eventually lost (the series can be found on Sullla's Youtube channel). It was a close series for the most part back then; going into the summer split, I think LMQ have the potential to be one of the top 3 or 4 teams in the region. I wish them luck :)

The thing that makes this all so exciting is that LoL is a zero sum game. All these teams want to same thing: to be the best and get to worlds. But not all of them are going to make it but we get to witness their epic struggle.
SO HYPED!!!! {{champion:222}}
I'm so excited to see Seraph in the LCS. He's killing it in the NA solo queue ladder.
